form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Enzi (for himself, Mr. Thune, Mr. Barrasso, and Mr. Portman) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt certain small businesses from the employer health insurance mandate and to modify the definition of full-time employee for purposes of such mandate.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Fairness in Health Care Act.

section.header: Restrictions on application of employer health insurance mandate

subsection.text: Section 4980H(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: The term applicable large employer shall not include any employer which is a small business concern (within the meaning of section 3 of the Small Business Act).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to months beginning after December 31, 2013.
